subject: Back to Pizza
event:
Our annual winter trip to Boskone and New York City is coming steadily closer, and with it the soon-to-be-infamous pizza crawl in New Haven.  Time to get organized.

My last post about this (two down, under the HBO news) drew a lot of comments.  Others responded by private email.  Sounds as though lots of folks want to be a part of our crawl, and try the famous slices of New Haven.

How many, though?  I'm not sure.  Some of those responding were interested but indefinite.  Others said, "I'm in," but they were posting anonymously, so I have no idea WHO is "in."  Others used their Live Journal handles and avatars... which is better than Anonymous, but in many cases I still don't know who you are.  Please, guys and gals, use your names, at least for this.  Otherwise we may end up with twenty people standing outside of Pepe's waiting for Billy the Mountain, none of them realizing that Billy the Mountain is really that quiet guy called Fred who turned up twenty minutes ago.

We do need to get a better notion of whether there are going to be ten of us, twenty, fifty, or a hundred (too many, I fear, and we may have logistical problems).

We could also use a volunteer on location in New Haven to help coordinate all this, someone to double check that all the pizza places are open, make reservations where reservations are accepted, and generally get our ducks in a row.  

So let's make it official now.  Who's in?  Not maybe, or I'd love to, or I'd-be-in-except-I-live-in-Istanbul, but definitely going-to-be-there-on-February-20 in.  And is there anyone there local who can take charge of organizing some of this?

I'll start.  Parris and I are in.  That's 2.

Oh, and please... only pizza crawl comments on this thread.  If you want to talk about the HBO deal, go down to my previous post and comment there.  I want this particular discussion to stay focused, thank you very much.

comments.article:
Wow I think I'm the first post. What an honor! I've never been first. I'm not going but I wanted to be first...

However I live in Chicago and I have a hard time believing that pizza in New Haven could be better than the pizza capital of the world... (lol) I'm sure it's good, but it's not Chicago good. If you're ever in town, you need to try the Art of Pizza on Ashland Ave.

Have a great time!
comments.subject: Am I first???

comments.article: I wasn't first by 6 minutes... continuing my streak of never being first...
comments.subject: Re: Am I first???

comments.article:
I shan't be in New Haven, but if you are going to be in NYC, I throw out this recommendation (though it's in Brooklyn, but it beats any pie I've ever had in Manhattan).

La Sorrentina (pizza and Italian restaurant next door).
6524 11th Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11219

George!

You and Parris are in, but which Pizza places are you officially crawling to? There were so many mentioned through your post and the billions of comments. I am thinking you are doing Pepe's and Sally's and Modern Pizza and even a few others were mentioned, but I am thinking these are the primary three... Would that be accurate? If so, what are the times you will be available?

Thanks,

Zeb
comments.subject: Even third is cool with me

comments.article:
Well, this is a pizza crawl, so ideally we want to sample the pizza at several different places... a minimum of three, I'd say... maybe four, if we can work out the logistics.

The four contenders that have been mentioned the most in the recommendations are Sally's, Frank Pepe's, Modern, and BAR.

Now we need to figure out when and how.

More on that below.
comments.subject: Re: Even third is cool with me

comments.article:
This sounds like fun. I'm a little under an hour away, so the only thing stopping me will be getting child care lined up. Look forward to meeting you at Boskone, too.

Lon Prater

comments.upictitle: Jeanne / Xaviara al'Nady / Tita Kini: PolarBear
comments.article: Please clarify, date and time. I remember "Wednesday" was mentioned, but no specific time? If during the day, I'd have to work, but dinner I wouldn't. I'd need these sorts of details to confirm. Thanks!
The 20th... if you read the post it says that. :) Times will more than likely be clarified (i assume) when we're closer to the date of and we have some sort of person coordinating.

I'm a definite to go. Waterdancer (from Ran's board). I'm missing Boskone, so I don't want to miss this. For sure.

I often travel through the area so I can talk to the owners and see if we can get some preferential treatement for a celebrity and get a decent group of tables. But I can't do that until we know how many are going to be there. To increase the odds of the pizza shop owners paying attention (and to get a little more attention for your books), I could contact the New Haven Register (the local newspaper) and maybe they could do a piece on the famous, best-selling author in town for a pizza judging.

By the way, I have no opinion on which pizza is better. I'm lactose intolerant, but will come for the company.

I sent a PM to Parris, so she can always PM me from Ran's board.

You should come out to California and do a Taco crawl. I admit we can't compete on the pizza level, but no one does Mexican food like we do it out west

Just a suggestion from a jealous reader who's too far away to make it and would probably have to work anyhow, knowing my boss =)

Ah... well... y'see, I live in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

Nobody does Mexican food that can compare to New Mexico's. At least not in the US. Maybe in Old Mexico.

Arizona's Sonoran style runs second, but a distant second.

Tex-Mex is even further behind.

California? Not even close.

Tacos are okay in their place, but we have chimichangas, carne adovada, sopapillas, red and green chile that will blow the top of your head off, breakfast burritos that will make you see god.

In fact, I almost never eat Mexican once I leave the borders of New Mexico. Nothing else compares.
comments.subject: Mexican food

comments.article:
Mr. Martin (George?),

I'm a bit of a techno-tard, so I don't have an online avatar, but I couldn't let this post slip by. I live in Boston with a couple of guys who grew up in Connecticut, and here's their take on New Haven Pizza:

1)It's fine, damn fine, and worth the wait, which is good because

2)There will be one. Sally's, Pepe's and Moderno's are all small, hole-in-the wall joints, and the locals have preference. Regarding reservations: when President Clinton was in office, he wanted to eat at Sally's and the Secret Service called to book the place. Sally's said "no." Which is awesome, but means we're probably in for some line-time. If we can get ahold of someone who knows the management, great. Otherwise, the reservation is being on the sidewalk.

That said, it doesn't hurt to call, just in case. But I can think of things a lot worse than hanging for a while with you and the people who post on this blog. New Haven in February is kinda like the wrong side of the Wall, but if we bundle up it should be fine.

And yeah, with all this "we" talk, I'm in. Main problem is transportation. If anyones is driving either direction with a seat to spare, I'd throw in for the gas, and it would be a huge help.

New England Winter, sizzling Pizza, Ice and Fire. Look forward to more details.

Seth Daniels
6'1", Brown Hair/Eyes, 22 years (Hehe, no worries posting details online with a description like that)
comments.subject: A Slice of Haven eh?

comments.article: Mr Seth Daniels, should we ever meet at a Con, I would like to buy you a beer for your praiseworthy ability to follow directions. :D
comments.subject: Re: A Slice of Haven eh?
Re: A Slice of Haven eh?
Re: A Slice of Haven eh?

(not the Cat Stevens shadow mooner who is also wanted by the FBI) although we may have that in common...  The Crawl sounds like a phenomenal idea that shall go down in the history books and might even make the evening news! *sigh* looking forward to munching some pepperoni and people watching people around the infamous you. See you in CT-maybe NY too.  on a separate pizza note there is John's pizza on bleeker that is Phenomenal! and Joe's on the corner of carmine and 6. my 2 personal fav's in the apple.

Joe's is good but I thought the place Joe's bought out & then closed down half way up the block towards 6th Ave was somewhat better. For the life of me I can't remember the name of it.

comments.article:
Come to Corvallis Oregon and I'll make you a pizza, anything you want, I'll even throw in a bunch of samplers for all the good local Microbrews around here.
And tell you what, I want even spend hours telling you about what I think you're books need story wise. I wont drivel on about how many ninjas are needed in which scene, or how a main character contracting lepercy would add to the overall mood of the storyline. (etc.) *smirks*
I think this is one of the better offers you will receive from one of you're fans.

Anyway, I wish you and you're gathering the best, but I'm telling you, homemade pizzas are better than any sort you'll ever try.
comments.subject: Come to Corvallis

Cheesy zombie movies, cheesy pizza, and cookies. An offer of a lifetime, or at least a week, or less.

comments.article: We won't be going but have a great time!

Hey GRRM,

Now, I have my favorites, but I would love to know which slices you favor in the Big snApple. Time Out NY did a pizza issue recently, but they definitely missed a few...particularly some epiphanic slices to be had in Brooklyn.

And I would really be appreciative if you didn't finish the Dance until the summer. I'm trying to finish a dissertation, so stretch it out if you can. Couldn't you install some Microsoft products on your writing computer or something? Your new books always keep me from my own writing!

Best of luck in Beantown, Yaleville, and the snApple.

comments.article:
I'd definitely be up for this.

By the way, to the earlier comment about having to wait in line. While this is very likely, it's possible that being a Tuesday (I think?) we might be able to get in without a wait. I actually just went to Pepe's last week on a Wednesday at about 5:00 and walked right in and sat at a table, and there were a decent amount of empty tables. A Friday or Saturday would be an almost certain hour long wait at least, but weekdays there's at least a chance you can walk right in. :)
